ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned basic spanish reading, writing, and speaking. Learned basic conversation abilities.
How to have a basic conversation in Spanish in the present and past tense.
I significantly developed my Spanish speaking, reading, and writing skills. I also got a chance to expose myself to various latin cultures, including some countries I had a special interest in.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strength- teaching style, I learned a lot of material 
Weakness-too fast and teacher wasnt very understanding of the fact that we were still in the midst of a pandemic and personal things were still going on
More direct ways to offer help would be helpful as well as less self studying and more teaching of concepts before making students study it on their own.
very fast paced, lots of material to cover if you have no prior spanish experience

The class was very organized and the in-class atmosphere was very friendly. The group assignments were very helpful in encouraging making friends with the online format. Assignments in larger groups than just two people would have been even better.
Lots of busy work - not built for everyone's learning style

Strengths - The professor was extremely engaged, approachable, and consistently challenged the students to improve their hold on class material. In terms of teaching style, this was by far the best course I have taken at Yale were I was encouraged to learn the material.

Weaknesses - The only weakness of the course was the constant use of breakout rooms, where we would go over questions from class but neither of the students would be able to say whether our responses were right or wrong, so they felt kind of useless.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Good engagement throughout the course. The only thing is that it would be helpful if students were allowed to connect more with each other. This is a problem I find in many courses virtually though.
The active participation in class helped a lot with preventing zoom fatigue and the group video assignments helped with making a friend in the class.
Even over an online platform, the professor did a great job of keeping everyone engaged by promoting class participation. I couldn't recommend any changes that would have made the course better.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes if you want to learn Spanish!

Yes, to understand and learn basic Spanish I would fully recommend it to students with the warning that they must be willing to put in the work to use Spanish outside of class as well as be prepared to study spanish well on their own as a huge part of the class is doing things on your own.
Yes. The class was a great experience and learning a new language is a very valuable skill.

I would definitely recommend this course to those who want to be placed on a fast track of learning spanish. I would say that it is difficult at first if you have never taken a spanish class before, but the workload is worth it in terms of how much of the language you get to learn by the end of the term.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
